title: Electricity sector in India
summary: India is the third largest producer of electricity in the world.[6] The national electric grid in India has an installed capacity of 388.134 GW as of 31 August 2021.[2] Renewable power plants, which also include large hydroelectric plants, constitute 37% of India's total installed capacity. During the fiscal year (FY) 2019-20, the gross electricity generated by utilities in India was 1,383.5 TWh and the total electricity generation (utilities and non utilities) in the country was 1,598 TWh.[7][8] The gross electricity consumption in FY2019 was 1,208 kWh per capita.[7] In FY2015, electric energy consumption in agriculture was recorded as being the highest (17.89%) worldwide.[3] The per capita electricity consumption is low compared to most other countries despite India having a low electricity tariff.[9]
